channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: Who is Istanbul Mayor Imamoglu who won big in Turkey local elections?
item.description: Opposition party CHP deals surprise blows to Erdogan as hopes raised for Imamoglu presidency in 2028.

item.title: Several killed in Israeli strike on Iranian consulate in Damascus: Reports
item.description: Mohammad Reza Zahedi, a senior commander in the IRGC, among at least five killed, Iranian state media reports.

item.title: Russian court extends detention of journalist Alsu Kurmasheva until June
item.description: Russian American is accused of failing to register as a ‘foreign agent’ and spreading ‘false information’.

item.title: ‘We Jews are just arrested; Palestinians are beaten’: Protesters in Germany
item.description: In Germany, phrases including ‘from the river to the sea’ are banned and police are arresting people for using them.

item.title: Israel leaves al-Shifa Hospital in ruins and littered with human remains
item.description: Dozens of bodies have been found at al-Shifa Hospital after the withdrawal of Israeli soldiers following a two-week raid

item.title: Why are so many young Americans suffering from mental distress?
item.description: Cost of living, university fees and gun crime are have all contributed to rise in depression since COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: US-based Formula 1 owner Liberty Media announces MotoGP takeover
item.description: The multibillion-dollar takeover places Formula 1 and MotoGP under the same Liberty Media ownership structure.

item.title: Turkish opposition wins major cities in local elections
item.description: Turkey’s main opposition Republican People’s Party (CHP) has dealt the biggest blow in two decades to President Erdogan.

item.title: As those fleeing al-Shifa get to south Gaza, they recount Israeli torture
item.description: Two people, one who was in the besieged hospital and one who lived nearby, tell of their ordeal to escape.

item.title: Israeli parliament passes law paving the way for Al Jazeera closure
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu promises to use the law to shutter local operations of Al Jazeera.

item.title: Russia calls off search for trapped gold miners
item.description: Rescuers say it's too dangerous to try to reach 13 miners buried underground in far eastern Amur region.

item.title: Pakistan court suspends Imran Khan’s prison sentence in state gifts case
item.description: Khan and his wife Bushra Bibi were each handed a 14-year sentence in the case in January.

item.title: Israel’s destruction of Gaza’s al-Shifa Hospital
item.description: The Israeli military has withdrawn from Gaza’s main hospital, leaving behind scenes of devastation.

item.title: Taliban ban on girls’ education defies both worldly and religious logic
item.description: The ban stands against the core principles of Islam and hinders Taliban's efforts to gain international recognition.

item.title: LeBron James ties a career high 3-point night as Lakers beat Nets 116-104
item.description: The 39-year-old goes nine-for-10 on 3-pointers as the Lakers record their sixth victory in their last seven NBA games.

item.title: How Israel is using starvation as a weapon of war
item.description: Rights groups say Israel is denying Palestinians in Gaza access to food and water, a war crime under international law.

item.title: ‘No life here’: Israel’s army withdraws from Gaza’s al-Shifa Hospital
item.description: Scenes of devastation reported after Israeli military ends two-week operation.

item.title: The UK’s new minimum wage ‘badly needed’ but many calling for more
item.description: UK's new legal minimum wage gets a 9.8 percent rise, the highest boost since 2001. But with inflation, it's not enough.

item.title: Are Sudan’s civil society activists being targeted by both warring sides?
item.description: Sudan's warring parties are using food as a weapon and targeting local activists for feeding their communities.

item.title: Key India opposition leader sent to jail until April 15 in corruption case
item.description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's custody extended less than three weeks before country votes in seven-phase polls.

item.title: Iran’s persecution of Baha’is branded ‘crime against humanity’
item.description: Human Rights Watch says minority group faces 'spectrum of abuses', including arbitrary arrest and property confiscation.

item.title: Israel’s war on Gaza: List of key events, day 178
item.description: The WHO calls for the evacuation of patients from al-Shifa Hospital, saying 21 patients have died since March 18.

item.title: Tens of thousands of Israelis rally against PM Netanyahu in Jerusalem
item.description: The protest in Jerusalem was the largest since Israel launched its war on Gaza in October.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 767
item.description: As the war enters its 767th day, these are the main developments.

item.title: South Korea’s Yoon accuses doctors of running ‘cartel’ as strike drags on
item.description: Yoon pledges not to back down on plans to increase medical school admissions.
